concept.title: About the view
concept.shortdesc: The view is divided into three main panels to provide a clear overview of the history of a branch or a file. By default, the view appears docked to the bottom of the window.

conbody.p: You can open the view from the toolbar or by using the Show history and Show blame context menu actions on a file in the staging area.

section.title: Commit log
section.p: The commit log panel lists all commits added to the current branch with additional information about the exact date and time when the changes were commited, the author of the commit, and short hash. The log is sorted by date in descending order.
If there are uncommited changes, they appear as a separate entry at the top of the list.

section.title: Commit details
section.p: The commit details panel displays detailed information about the commit that is currently selected in the log.

You can use this panel to preview a commit's long hash, its parent commit short hash, the change author's full name and email address, the exact date and time when the commit was added, and the full text of the commit message.

section.title: Committed changes
section.p: The list of committed changes panel displays changes introduced by the currently selected commit. Each file listed in this panel is supplied with additional status icons to indicate the type of the change (addition, modification, or deletion).
This panel also provides per-file context menu actions to compare the selected version with the previous version or the version currently present in your working copy.
